content: First, the sending of messages is neither IMAP nor POP; instead, it is SMTP. It may help to post a screenshot of the SMTP server pane so readers here see exactly what thunderbird sees. My guess (and it's only that), is that authentication needs to be other than 'no authentication.' Try 'normal password.' Also, be sure to use the full email address, not just the prefix.
creator: davidsk

content: Mark those messages accidentally marked as spam as 'Not Spam'. Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: christ1

content: I'm glad the problem is solved. In future, please stay with the original thread instead of posting two separate ones. It causes confusiion. thanks.
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest first seeing if you can use the print feature and select a PDF-printer. Microsoft includes that, I believe, with all Windows.
creator: davidsk

content:
If you are on Windows and use a Thunderbird 140 esr or a Thunderbird release version beneath v147 you can install the add-on "ImportExportTools NG" https://services.addons.thunderbird.net/EN-us/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/ which allows to export messages in the .pdf format (image)

Probably you'll have to save attachments and send them to your bank separately, together with the corresponding .pdf message export files.
creator: Mapenzi

content: I believe there is a bug in that addon now for PDFs in 147.
creator: davidsk
